pros: I was a former long time employee at Elmira College and my review is long overdue. I always appreciated the excellent work life balance and respect from the community. As an Elmira native, I was proud to be a part of something with such a great history. I've also seen it grow in diversity. If how you spend your time is important to you, then EC offers that not-for-profit environment rather than a corporate mindset.
cons: High turnover, especially with senior management which may unfortunately be disruptive

pros: The college has long standing traditions
cons: Sometimes change takes a bit of time
The school in general isn’t this best

job_title: IT Help Desk Manager in Elmira, NY
pros: Some departments and individuals are ok, but most are not anymore.
cons: They don't care about their employees.

review_title: No future at Elmira, don't bother
pros: Campus is nice. Not a difficult job
cons: Pay is far below market rate, no one has received a raise in years. Massive turnover in faculty and administration. Students are not smart or hard working.
College can be very difficult at times.

pros: campus, students, co-workers, that's it, nothing else
cons: management, leadership team, pay, no raises, toxic culture
the treatment of humans is bad

job_title: Graduate Assistant Athletic Trainer in Elmira, NY
pros: Family like atmosphere and great coworkers

review_title: Poor management, lies, secrecy, and backstabbing are the norm
job_title: Full Time Faculty in Elmira, NY
pros: It was great to be able to help the students.
cons:
Elmira College used to have such potential, but now it is a cesspool of lies and secrecy. Unfortunately, students can no longer get a good education here, and it is a horrible place to work unless you are one of the chosen few. The college says its recent cuts were because of "financial exigency" (something the full faculty learned about only as several of them were fired at the end of the last academic year) because of the pandemic, but that is not the case.

A few select people make all of the decisions at this college and others, including the students, pay the price. There is a culture of backstabbing among the faculty that is encouraged by the administration. I would steer clear of this place as both a place of employment and a place to get an education. The quality of the education has diminished significantly, despite what the college's advertising says. The college has been in financial trouble for a long time, and using the pandemic as an excuse to fire long-term faculty and administrators is morally bankrupt. This is not a place you want to work.

pros: There are many hard working people on Campus that would like to see the College move forward.
cons: The new Upper Management really has no clue. It appears that if you are unqualified and a bully you manage to get ahead. Most people are working at EC to get the tuition benefit, otherwise they would be crazy!! The pay sucks and never any raises unless its the minimum wage requirements.  My Community College education was so much better than the education I received at Elmira College. At one time I thought things were going to change but the College still has not hired a permanent President and it appears the new people are not invested in the Elmira area so they really do not care.

pros: Teaching experience.  There are no other pros but this portion needs to hit twenty words minimum.  Teaching experience.  Teaching experience (which might not even be worth it).
cons: Worst city I've ever lived.  College: Bloated administration, a blind leading the blind mentality, a build the bridge as we're walking on it mentality.  No foresight.  Extreme gaps in skill from top students to bottom students.  The price of tuition Elmira College charges their students for a below average education, and knowing, as an employee, you are a part of the charade.

review_title: You get what you put in.
pros: The amount of experience you will gain and receive from being employeed at Elmira College is by far greater than at other places. When being compared to others who do the same job, they do far less and have less experience and less responsibility.
cons: Working at Elmira College is not a job, it is a lifestyle. The hours are long and the need for dedication is stronger than other places of employment.

pros: Small campus, so everything is central and takes 2-3 minutes to walk across the campus.  Starbucks on site.
cons: Interim presidents every couple of years make for a very disorganized environment.  Shrinking incoming classes year to year.  Poor morale, zero collaboration - very little support for faculty.

pros: full-timers get educational benefits; facilities are very nice, many improvements in all areas in the last few years.  Not a lot else in area so good comparatively speaking.
cons: pay scales are very low and secretly negotiable; coming off years of a rigid administration and folks are still adjusting.

pros: Great staff to work with. Bosses were very sweet.
cons: Sometimes there were not enough employees to cover all the shifts without being overworked while also taking classes.

-No communication
-Expected to do drop everything for the position
-Regulation- Extreme: monitor all your behavior

pros: Pretty campus, great people in lower management positions.
cons: Horrible city, horrible pay, horrible upper management, incredible decline in enrollment.

pros: Free classes were about the only thing.
cons: Very low pay compared with others in my industry (computer technology)
